{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents provide information on the correlation between cusp angulations and various occlusal determinants. The 'cusp writer' is a teaching aid used to facilitate understanding of this correlation. In Part II of the document, it explains that cusps appear to be steep or shallow relative to each other, to the plane of occlusion, and to the plane of motion. This information suggests that working cusps are likely related to the optimal height and angulation of teeth in relation to each other.", "answer_choice": "A"}
